ratings.comment: No disrespect but bro was so boring. Like this class was insufferable. Man is kinda old so it was hard to understand him at time. Don't get me wrong he was a funny guy but just not really someone you wanna learn econ through.

Prof. Walker definitely had a difficult time switching to the digital platform and never really got his stuff together. The class was inconsistent, boring, and I still really have no idea what I'm supposed to be doing going into finals week. I learned very little in this class, but I genuinely feel bad for the guy. Nice guy, awful execution.

This is a nice man, so I don't want to come across as disrespectful but he is not capable of organizing a class in a coherent way. Shows up late every day, can't organize his canvas page, sends his emails to the wrong class and on top of all that, the exams he gives you are difficult to prepare for because he spends all lecture time rambling

Econ 305 is a pretty good class if your interested in economic theory, but not formal mathematics. Professor Walker is wise and worldly and often times pretty funny. Sometimes lectures can be hard to follow when he drones off, but they're usually pretty interesting. 2 papers and 2 exams including final. Not too hard not too easy.

Good professor with interesting lectures. He has a good sense of humor, so if you pay attention the lectures can be quite entertaining. Sometimes he goes rouge and tries to write on the board instead of using a powerpoint, and these lectures can be hard to follow. Besides this critique, it's a really good class and he seems to care about students.

Professor Walker was a great professor, and a really kind person. Class was challenging, but I learned a lot about economic history, and if you attended lecture or read the readings, exams were very doable. You're graded on a few large assignments, and attendance is randomly taken during lecture. I'd recommend this class!

Econ 466 with Walker was enjoyable. He's very friendly and regularly cracks jokes during lecture. Content of the course is pretty interesting and makes for a nice diversion from the strictly quantitative economics that comprise most of the econ course offerings. Exams are much easier to study for if you partner/group with others in the class.

Prof. Walker is very nice, yet insufferable to listen too. His voice in monotone and he is so lethargic. You are graded on a couple of big ticket items late in the semester. As long as you hit the targets, you should be fine. Random attendance is taken.

Lectures are only worth going to because he'll take "attendance" by having you answer one question on a notecard. Full points if you're there and answer, though. Tests are hard but he gives you some of the questions beforehand. Can drone off during lecture and not refer to the notes on the slides. Nice guy, but doesn't make material interesting.
Good and super nice Professor. It was not easy to go through all the readings but they helped a lot and you learn a lot about Economics.

Prof. Walker is a super nice guy but lectures can be long and lack energy. Material is super interesting (History of Economic Thought) which helps out in my opinion. Not too difficult to do well. 2 Exams, 1 Paper, and a lot of reading (assigned).  I never used the textbook.
Maybe the worst professor I've had. No connection between homework, lectures, discussion sections, and exams. Take him if you hate yourself.
don't take this class!! no connection between lecture and exams. this class is the worst that i have taken so far.

Most boring professor I have ever had.  When studying the material for exams I realized how interesting the topic was; however, I would have never known how interesting it was from class because he talks in circles with pointless stories.
Walker was so nice but SUPER boring.  I could barely stay awake during class.  I love econ but I could not wait for the semester to end so I could be done with this class.
Topic taught was interesting (pop & society) but was not easy. Walker was very easy to talk to and very accomodating to my schedule and explained things enough to get me a B in his class.

if you do not come from a background of statistics, try to not take this guy. i can't understand a thing he says. he makes a very interesting subject boring and impossible. if it wasn't for my TA's abilities, i'd be contemplating suicide right now. i mean he's NICE, but i think walker assumes we've all been grown on a probability farm.
